title: 111_hr1035
content: The Act is titled the "Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental Policy Amendments Act of 2009." It amends the Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 to be known as the "Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act." The Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act is amended to include provisions for scholarship, internship, and fellowship programs related to the environment and Native American tribal policy and health care, as well as environmental conflict resolution services and leadership. Stewart L. Udall is committed to contributing to public policy by developing future environmental and Native American leaders and improving decision-making on environmental, energy, and tribal governance issues. Stewart L. Udall had a significant impact on environmental and Native American policy during his time as Secretary of the Interior, overseeing the creation of numerous national parks, monuments, seashores, lakeshores, and wildlife refuges. His leadership and vision in these areas are honored through the Udall Foundation. The Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act is amended to include Stewart L. Udall in the definitions section. The Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act is amended to establish the foundation and define its authority. The Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act is amended to authorize the foundation to conduct training, research, and other activities. Recipients of scholarships, fellowships, and internships under this Act will be known as 'Udall Scholars', 'Udall Fellows', and 'Udall Interns'. The Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act is amended to establish a trust fund and regulate expenditures, including official reception expenses not exceeding $5,000 per fiscal year. The Act also allows federal agencies or other entities to utilize the institute. The Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act allows federal agencies or other entities to utilize the institute for independent assessments, mediation, or conflict resolution without being considered an advisory committee under the Federal Advisory Committee Act. Administrative provisions are also included. Section 12(a) of the Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act is amended to allow the appointment of necessary personnel without following competitive service rules. Compensation for appointed personnel is capped at the GS-15 grade level, with exceptions for up to 4 employees. In amending Section 12(a) of the Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation Act, changes include allowing the appointment of personnel without competitive service rules and capping compensation at the GS-15 grade level, with exceptions for up to 4 employees. Additionally, the amendment includes provisions for renting office space in the District of Columbia or its environs. SEC. 11. Authorization of appropriations amended to allow necessary sums for the Trust Fund and the Environmental Dispute Resolution Fund operating costs.
